dublinCore.dc:title: S1596 ENR: Jocelyn Nungaray National Wildlife Refuge Act
dublinCore.dc:rights: Pursuant to Title 17 Section 105 of the United States Code, this file is not subject to copyright protection and is in the public domain.

form.congress: One Hundred Nineteenth Congress of the United States of America
form.enrolled-dateline: Begun and held at the City of Washington on Friday, the third day of January, two thousand and twenty five
form.current-chamber: IN THE SENATE OF THE UNITED STATES
form.official-title: To rename the Anahuac National Wildlife Refuge located in the State of Texas as the Jocelyn Nungaray National Wildlife Refuge.

section.text: This Act may be cited as the Jocelyn Nungaray National Wildlife Refuge Act.

paragraph.text: On June 17, 2024, 12-year-old Jocelyn Nungaray was brutally murdered in Houston, Texas.
Two illegal aliens who were allegedly members of the Tren de Aragua gang have been charged with her murder.

On March 4, 2025, President Donald J. Trump signed Executive Order 14229 (90 Fed. Reg. 11585; relating to honoring Jocelyn Nungaray) renaming the area known as the Anahuac National Wildlife Refuge to Jocelyn Nungaray National Wildlife Refuge.
Ms. Nungaray loved animals and, given the close proximity of her hometown of Houston, it is fitting that the Anahuac National Wildlife Refuge be renamed in her honor.

section.header: Renaming of Anahuac National Wildlife Refuge

subsection.text: The Anahuac National Wildlife Refuge located in the State of Texas shall be known as the Jocelyn Nungaray National Wildlife Refuge.

Any reference in a law, map, regulation, document, paper, or other record of the United States to the national wildlife refuge referred to in subsection (a) shall be deemed to be a reference to the Jocelyn Nungaray National Wildlife Refuge.

attestation-group.role: Speaker of the House of Representatives
Vice President of the United States and President of the Senate
